subject: Re: [junit] execute code upon failed test in junit 4
msgSnippet: It s not currently possible in a simple way, but I think I know the right way to build the possibility into 4.7.  Feel free to log a feature request to track
messageBody:
It's not currently possible in a simple way, but I think I know the
right way to build the possibility into 4.7. Feel free to log a
feature request to track progress.

That said, if you're willing to write a custom Runner class, you could
get this behavior.

David Saff

On Fri, Apr 17, 2009 at 2:02 AM, mykro76 <danieljcarr@...> wrote:
> I'm using Junit 4 annotations, @Before, @After, @Test, etc.  I can't find a way to execute code only when a test fails.   In essence, an @OnFail annotation.  Is this possible?
>
> The only solutions I've seen posted in this list were for Junit3, or involved setting a success flag at the end of *every* test.  Neither of which is very appealing.
>
> Backstory: I created a CacheAppender for log4j which stores large volumes of DEBUG level logging.  ERROR, WARN, INFO etc continue to go to the default ConsoleAppender in realtime.  If the test fails, I want to dump the contents of CacheAppender to the ConsoleAppender.  If the test succeeds I want to discard this extra logging.   Is there a better way I could be doing this?
>
> Thanks!
